answers.answer: You need to find an endocrinologist who specializes in thyroids (call around, most only deal with diabetes).  There are some good ENTs too who deal with thyroids.  The endocrinologist/ENT needs to do a thyroid ultrasound, possibly a CT scan, and a *complete* set of thyroid labs.  From there they need to decide if the nodules (we don't like to call them tumors but it's the same thing) are "suspicious" or not.  If they are suspicious they may suggest a fine needle aspiration/biopsy (FNA).  They may also discuss suppression therapy (medication), surgery, or "wait and watch".For most general doctors, thyroid problems are *way* beyond their capability.Utahmommapapillary carcinomathree sisters with papillary carcinoma
